titleStmt.title: A scribe, pharisee, hypocrite; and his letters answered, separates churched, dippers sprinkled: or, A vindication of the church and universities of England, in many orthodox tenets & righteous practices. Whereunto is added a narration of a publick dipping, June 26. 1656. In a pond of much Leighes parish in Essex, with a censure thereupon. By Jeffry Watts B.D. and Rectour of Much-Leighes.
titleStmt.author: Watts, Geoffrey, d. 1663.

titleStmt.title: A scribe, pharisee, hypocrite; and his letters answered, separates churched, dippers sprinkled: or, A vindication of the church and universities of England, in many orthodox tenets & righteous practices. Whereunto is added a narration of a publick dipping, June 26. 1656. In a pond of much Leighes parish in Essex, with a censure thereupon. By Jeffry Watts B.D. and Rectour of Much-Leighes.
titleStmt.author: Watts, Geoffrey, d. 1663.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Edward Dod, at the Gun in Ivy Laine, and for Thomas Johnson, at the Golden Key in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: "Of baptisme" and "The dipper sprinkled" have separate pagination and register.
'Scribe .. hypocrite' and 'letter answered .. dippers sprinkled' are bracketed together on the titlepage.
"Of baptisme" identified on reel as Thomason 138:E.921[2], but is part of E.921[1].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
